lenders.name: Mabel
lenders.loan_because: my mom and I like helping women be strong and able to take care of themselves.

lenders.name: Peggy
lenders.loan_because: My family and I have been blessed with a good life. It is important to give back. "What you do to these you do to Me"
lenders.occupational_info: I am a family doctor who takes care of people of all ages.My focus is on wellness: keeping healthy

lenders.name: Michele
lenders.loan_because: I like helping the less fortunate.

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.occupation: Managing Director for Alternative Investment Fund
lenders.loan_because: micro lending is an important part of fostering economic growth in countries that often have limited access to credit due to conditions outside of the control of the average business person. Having a deep understanding of the way credit markets work, along with a cultural sensitivity, I realize that often the only way for Kiva borrowers to grow their business is to look outside their country for access to credit due to the inefficient and ineffective internal credit market.

lenders.name: Todd
lenders.loan_because: We have incredible fortune and opportunity here.  I wish to share just a small portion of that.  Those who are given much will be held accountable for much.  I am about empowering people, and that is what this site does.
lenders.occupational_info: I treat medical disorders of the foot and ankle.

lenders.name: Sylvia
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed and want to give back to my sisters in need.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on a computer, using my head and my hands 8 hours a day.

lenders.name: Mazel
lenders.loan_because: I've been blessed to have achieved more than I ever dreamed.  I want to pass on some of my blessings to others who are less fortunate but no less hard working.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired from work but not from an extremely active lifestyle.  I am a freeelance travel writer, an ESL tutor, tennis player, skier, and avid reader.

lenders.name: Marjorie
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed to have economic opportunities, I want to help my brothers and sisters around the world.

lenders.name: Michel
lenders.loan_because:
As a member of this global community called Earth, I believe in helping your neighbor when you can.
"Never look down on anybody unless you're helping him up."  -Jesse Jackson

lenders.name: Jamie & Luisana
lenders.loan_because: Why not?
lenders.occupational_info: Get airplane from point A to point B.

lenders.name: Sheri
lenders.loan_because: Kiva empowers me to make a difference.  It is inspiring to see what is possible when we work together.

lenders.name: Monserrat
lenders.loan_because: To help out other women in the world.

lenders.name: Sterling Riber
lenders.loan_because: We are a group in a Western Washington University class doing a presentation on Kiva and we want to help someone's goals succeed.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I can... because I have been blessed... I loan because,  if I can create opportunity for someone else, it is the closest thing I have to spreading my good fortune,  my love,  my support, and living my values every time I loan.  I become part of a greater collective spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: Teaching and supporting the medical community as a technical analyst for a health care provider

lenders.name: Scott & Anna
lenders.loan_because: We love the idea of being able to help people to help themselves.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: it is the right thing to do. These opportunities to change someone's life come at a small cost to us -- the expense of a dinner out or a DVD unpurchased. They make a great difference to those who want to improve their lives - and the lives of their family and communities.

lenders.name: Janet
lenders.loan_because: it's a more direct and personal way to help someone.
lenders.occupational_info: I program and monitor satellite science instruments to observe how the Earth and its atmosphere interact and to study how this affects the health of our planet and our quality of life.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I want the world to be a better place.

lenders.name: jeannie
lenders.loan_because: i feel grateful for the security i have in my life and i want to help others feel more secure in their lives
lenders.occupational_info: i take care of my kids and i work.  i work with people to help show them how to save money on their healthcare expenditures

lenders.name: Maddie
lenders.loan_because: I care about your life!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student

lenders.name: Catherine
lenders.occupational_info: I am a college student

lenders.name: Gil
lenders.loan_because: God moves me to help.

lenders.name: Sylvia
lenders.occupation: Retired United Church of Canada Diaconal Minister

lenders.name: anne
lenders.loan_because: I care and I want to help those in need. I want to let them know that we do care. It is just a great way to make an impact on someone's life. I'm very excited to know about this website, because I believe in life and hope! One small step at a time to achieve our goals in this world :D Pay it forward!
lenders.occupational_info: A student with a passion to see others succeed! :)

lenders.name: Tom Fitzpatrick
lenders.loan_because:
Micro-Lending is a hand up and not simply a hand out.  The free market offers the emerging world the best path toward prosperity and a bright future shaped by their own dreams and ambitions. KIVA offers me a direct one to one relationship with an entrepreneur some where else on the planet. 

My students in my SIFE Chapter and my International Business class have made over 400 loans to 40+ countries the past two years  and I am very proud of them!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a professor of International Business and Marketing.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: I want to see entrepreneurs prosper in third world countries.
lenders.occupational_info: I make web sites that provide businesses new ways to flourish--like Kiva.org.

lenders.name: Tatiana
lenders.loan_because: To me $25 is a cute pair of shoes or a couple songs on iTunes! But for someone else across the world that means money for a new house! Or money to rebuild a school! Or money to EAT! Even money for a new business! Even though I will probably never meet these people I want to help make a difference in SOMEONES life! Even if 1 life is the only I can get to before I die...I want to know the world was a better place because of me! $25.00 at a time... I can change the world.

lenders.name: Amin
lenders.loan_because: All deserve to dream, and make our dreams come true ...

lenders.name: Sudeep Dhillon
lenders.loan_because: I like the concept of leveraging Entrepreneurs to improve the quality of life of the individual and hope that their business creates additional employment in their community.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a large international bank and have held positions in lending and credit and undersand the power of micro-lending and what it can do to create opportunities for hard working, enterprising and ethical individuals.

lenders.name: Branksome Hall Kiva Club
lenders.loan_because: We want to help the world one business at a time.

lenders.name: Phoebe
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping others.

lenders.name: Jon
lenders.loan_because: positive karma is always a good thing to have on your side.

lenders.name: Shinyasu
lenders.loan_because: Now, I'm starting new business. I'd like to contribute others.

lenders.name: Manuel
lenders.loan_because: I borrow

lenders.name: Eliza
lenders.loan_because: it's the least I can do.

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: A small action that can make a large difference in people's lives.

lenders.name: Stacie
lenders.loan_because: no interest loans offer a great way to fund small business that can have big impact to the owner, their family and their community!
lenders.occupational_info: I buy, manage and sell office, industrial and retail real estate.

lenders.name: Lauren and Saul
lenders.loan_because: it was a wonderful gift idea for our wedding that allows us to continuely reinvest in the potential of people across the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I provide assistance and educational tools to community relations and environment practitioners in our organisation to help them implement our commitments to corporate social responsibilty.

lenders.name: Katherine
lenders.loan_because: Economic Self-sufficiency is one of the pillars to reduce suffering, domestic violence, trafficking and powerlessness, and improve families and communities.
lenders.occupational_info: Entrepreneur, Community Volunteer, Leader, Mentor

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I know what it is like to struggle to raise a family.  I can't think of anything more worthy than helping someone help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I currently have a very routine, low-paying job, but I working towards my dreams of a better life through a better job.

lenders.name: Jaya
lenders.loan_because: the disparities in the world are too great and have been created through past and current injustices.

lenders.name: sharon
lenders.loan_because: If I needed seed money to start up or expand my small business that was essential to supporting my family, I would hope that someone might be willing to invest in me.

lenders.name: Stefanie
lenders.loan_because: I want to help women to be independent from men. In so many countries women and girls are still worth less than men and to change that, women need to be able to earn enough money not to have to rely on men.

lenders.name: Ivo
lenders.loan_because:
Stimulating entrepreneurship is the only aid that will improve welfare in the long run. 

I am happy that I can make a small contribution.

lenders.name: YAY Images
lenders.loan_because: We lend because we are entrepreneurs and want to help other entrepreneurs. We also appreciate the opportunity to help others help themselves, and to try to make the world a little bit better. YAYimages.com encourage all their contributors and customers to join us here at Kiva!
lenders.occupational_info: We run a microstock agency, selling images and illustrations.

lenders.name: Andrew, Wendy & Karina
lenders.loan_because: It's good to be able to help others in need and is a valuable lesson to our daughter in community values.

lenders.name: Mario
lenders.loan_because: I care

lenders.name: Sam
lenders.loan_because: I appreciate the power of microloans and how programs like Kiva can change lives in a powerful, sustainable way.
lenders.occupational_info: I create and lead companies that build value for all participants -- employees, shareholders, clients and managers.

lenders.name: Felipe
lenders.loan_because: It's a way to help lots of people around the world. the beauty of Kiva work is to make it possible by joint actions from thousands of people all over the world. I'm proud to be part of them.
lenders.occupational_info: I help scientists to bring their inventions gto the market. By doing so, we are crossing the bridge between science and society, bringing real benefits, jobs and wealth to the world.

lenders.name: marian
lenders.loan_because: I have respect for people who start a business and I will be more than  happy to invest!!
lenders.occupational_info: I buy products for a big store. I travel and go to different places to select the merchandise.

lenders.name: Venus
lenders.loan_because: You are Me...  we are eternally connected by love, life and the will to prosper. I will  blessings upon all righteous things you desire.

lenders.name: Katie
lenders.loan_because: its fun

lenders.name: Shamal
lenders.loan_because: Sometimes, it's easy to think that making a difference is too difficult or even impossible but KIVA makes it so easy.
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies identify how their HR department can be more efficient and help them achieve their desired state by implementing new systems, redesigning processes, designing org structures and providing strategic recommendations.

lenders.name: bellur
lenders.loan_because: It is the only way to make the world a little better for others. I strongly believe in sharing my fortunes with others less fortunate. I am glad that finally I found a place where I can help.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a pediatrician in practice for the last 31 years. I am trying to make a difference in a child"s life one at a time.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: I like to help others and make a difference. It says in the bible when you give it will come back 10 fold
lenders.occupational_info: I help special needs individuals live full and active lives. I make sure that they are not abused or taken advantage of. I help ensure their health and a good quality of life

lenders.name: Marianne
lenders.loan_because: I want to give entrepreneurial people a chance to succeed.

lenders.name: J Scott
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.occupational_info: I contribute to the software HubSpot.com provides.

lenders.name: Vita
lenders.loan_because: those who are deserving deserves a chance to make a better life for themselves.

lenders.name: Claire
lenders.loan_because: I want to support people - especially women - who are trying to earn a living under very difficult circumstances

lenders.name: Matt
lenders.loan_because: it's really cool.
lenders.occupational_info: I help smart people work smarter.

lenders.loan_because: Individuals who share good will and mutual interests are our best hope for a world without war.

lenders.name: Fabio
lenders.loan_because: I want to help!

lenders.name: JUSTINA & JULIAN
lenders.loan_because: I'VE ALWAYS WANTED TO HELP OTHER PEOPLE. BUT BEING SO BUSY RAISING MY SON, EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES, WORKING I'VE NEVER SEEMED TO HAVE THE TIME. AFTER READING BILL CLINTON BOOK ,I READ THE SECTION ON THIS. I KNEW EVEN IF I DIDN'T HAVE TIME , I COULD STILL DO IT MAYBE NOT PHYSICALLY, BUT DEFINITELY OVER THE INTERNET. I AM HAPPY TO DO IT AND CONSIDER MY SELF LUCKY TO HAVE WHAT I HAVE. IT MAY NOT BE MUCH, BUT WHAT I DO HAVE I AM HAPPY TO GIVE.
lenders.occupational_info: I WORK IN A ORTHODONTIC OFFICE. WE HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS GET STRAIGHT TEETH.

lenders.name: Cindy
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy helping others and I want you to be able to support your families.
lenders.occupational_info: I help kids who have disabilities learn to use their hands to play and eat.

lenders.name: Donna
lenders.loan_because: Small is the way to spend.  Small loans from many people will change the world.

lenders.name: glenn
lenders.loan_because: I was fortunate enough to have people help me when I needed help, and now I want to return the favor and help those who are brave enough to try.

lenders.name: Judy
lenders.loan_because: Because so many has help me though out my life, this is a way I can give back.
lenders.occupational_info: I wanted to be at home more for my children.  I am a mom of 4 and two are still at home.  They don't stay young forever!

lenders.name: Evelyn
lenders.loan_because: It makes an enormous difference in many lives.

lenders.name: Christian
lenders.loan_because:
This just makes sense and I can see that it will make a difference.

I have kids and want them to learn the value of giving.

You can learn more about why I contribute at reading about "10x"

lenders.name: Grant, Lisa and Winston
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to give and is the right way to live. I would rather give my money to steadfast individuals than wasting it on temporary pleasures provided by: Nordstrom’s, McDonalds, Best Buy etc. Okay, maybe a few items from Best Buy.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a team of I.T. professionals for a local college.

lenders.name: Mitra
lenders.loan_because: It's our duty, as good citizens, to spread our good fortune to those who are trying to make a better life for themselves, their family and their community.
lenders.occupational_info: I am attempting to raise a child who will become an adult who is socially responsible and realizes that helping others has unlimited benefits for our world.

lenders.name: Karan
lenders.loan_because: I work with a student who wanted to fund raise to help others in another country.

lenders.name: Kyle
lenders.occupation: Program Coordinator at Inner-city Community Center

lenders.name: Douglas
lenders.loan_because: I want people to have the same opportunity that I have been given.
lenders.occupational_info: I primarily specialize in speculative investing in equities and real estate.

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.occupational_info: I help service-based entrepreneurs Make a Living while Making a Difference

lenders.name: Bixente
lenders.loan_because:
I want to help constructively people in poor countries with little to no access to any funds to start or develop their business.

Helping poor countries get better through sustainable ventures will help the world and reduce inequalities.

This is also why I PLEDGE NOT TO LEND TO ANY WESTERN WORLD "ENTREPRENEUR" as it would be contrary to my idea of Kiva and why I join in the first place.

lenders.name: Darrel
lenders.loan_because: Access to capital is the essential base requirement for economic freedom.

lenders.name: Mary Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: I care for others.

lenders.name: Christine
lenders.loan_because: I think this scheme is a brilliant way of getting money direct to the people who need it
lenders.occupational_info: I own a company which supplies first aid products such as kits, plasters and bandages along with customised kits to all industries

lenders.name: Cynthia
lenders.loan_because: I have been given much.  Even though I am just above the poverty line by American standards, I know I am much richer tham most of the world.  I want to be able to help women with children to make better lives for themselves.  I love to garden, so I like to help women who are involved in raising food.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach writing and women's studies at a university of 20,000 students.  I am a mother of a beautiful 21 year old son.

lenders.name: Andy
lenders.loan_because: It lets me make a real difference in somebody's life.

lenders.name: Pardon the Shark
lenders.loan_because: I really believe that the way to end poverty is to empower and educate people.  As the saying goes "Give a man a fish and feed him for a day.  Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime".
lenders.occupational_info: My job is to help people increase their net worth (make more money).  I advise people on what investments will help them make more money so that they can have a comfortable retirement, make charitable gifts, provide for their children, etc....I deal with stocks, bonds, mutual funds, commodities, and other securities that are traded around the world.

lenders.name: Joshua Home Edwards
lenders.loan_because:
Welcome Friend,

If you're reading these words it is possible you're interested in my professional biography because there may be some way I can serve your purpose. 


My intention with this message is to share my background with you in a way where you can get a better sense of how my services might be beneficial for you and...before you read any more, I encourage you to check in with your Spirit to ask:


Is the process of reading this message actually the best use of your time? 


If it's not I wholeheartedly invite you to move on to the direction that is optimal for you and if this is currently the best place for you to be, I truly thank you for seeing what's available for you here.       


With that being said, my response to the situation in the Horn of Africa and all the other under-served areas around the globe is to give it everything I've got to help bring about a Fully Nourished World for everyone in our lifetime (and I'm calling forth miracles here...everybody in the world deserves a full belly every day).  


So, I provide Kiva loans when I'm guided and I say more than 1,000 prayers over the course of what usually amounts to 2 hours every day to move this vision forward...internally and externally...knowing that this is currently the best way for me to be effective (my total at the moment is more than 1,201,312).


I also serve as a tele-conference conductor for some of the world's leading change agents and I encourage you to google some of the people and organizations that I've served including: Barack Obama, Michelle Obama, Joe Biden, Dr. Jill Biden, Dr. Jean Houston, Alicia Keys, Eva Longoria, George Lopez, SARK, Neale Donald Walsch, Marianne Williamson, Les Brown, T. Harv Eker, Martha Beck, Caroline Kennedy, Joanne Shenandoah, Habitat for Humanity, Melanie Griffith, Russell Simmons, Carole King, Lena Dunham, Lilly Ledbetter, Kevin Liles, Jared Leto, Lisa Sasevich, The World Bank, the National Science Foundation, The United Nations, The U.S. Department of Education, The Honorable Madeleine Dube (Minister of Social Development for New Brunswick, Canada), Barbara Marx Hubbard, Rickie Byars Beckwith, Dr. Michael Beckwith, Ken Wilbur, Hazel Henderson, Gregg Braden, Dr. Joan Borysenko, Dr. Bruce Lipton, Riane Eisler, James O'Dea, Panache Desai, Jennifer Mclean, Ervin Laszlo, Bill Gladstone, Barnet Bain, Dr. Rachel Naomi Remen, John Robbins, Sylvia Boorstein, Jack Kornfield, Sharon Salzberg, Gina Maria Mele (Co-Founder of the Massive Belief Relief clearing process), Lynne and Bill Twist (Co-Founders of the Pachamama Alliance), Zap Mama (International Recording Artist), Xiuhtezcatl Martinez, (a 12-year-old Youth Environmental Activist), Ben Jealous (President of the NAACP), Mike Brune (President of the Sierra Club), George Zimmer (Founder of the Men's Wearhouse), Lynne McTaggart (Author of "The Intention Experiment", guest on the Oprah Winfrey Show), Kathleen Sebelius (the 21st Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services, named by Forbes as one of the 100 most powerful women in the world), Sally Jewell (United States Secretary (Governor of Ohio), Former Senator Russ Feingold, Martin O'Malley (Governor of Maryland, Chair of the Democratic Governors Association).


Henry Cisneros (the 10th United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development), Cecelia Munoz (White House Director of Intergovernmental Affairs), Congressman Charlie Gonzalez, Congresswoman Lois Capps, Kathy Ruemmler (White House Counsel), Van Jones (author of "The Green Collar Economy"), Matthew Barzun (OFA Finance Chairman, former Ambassador to Sweden), Heather Colburn (National Women's Vote Director for OFA), Patrick Gaspard, (Executive Director of the Democratic National Committee), Katherine Archuleta (OFA Political Director), Jeremy Bird (OFA National Field Director), Marlon Marshall (OFA Deputy National Field Director), Mitch Stewart (OFA Battleground States Director), MoveOn.org (a 7 million member Civic Action community), Sam Daley-Harris (Founder of RESULTS.org), Tom Coleman (CEO of the Bottom Billion Fund -- http://bottombillionfund.org --which is a microfinance organization that focuses solely on the 1.4 billion people who are subsisting on less than $1.25 a day).
 

Dr. Matthew Fox (Author of "Original Blessing" and "In the Beginning there was Joy"), Andrew Harvey (Sacred Activist, Mystic, Oxford Scholar), Grandmother Maria Alice from the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers (sponsored by the CenterforSacredStudies.org), Peter Yarrow and Bethany Yarrow (from the "Peter, Paul and Mary" song group), Crescent Dragonwagon (author of more than 50 books), David Koff (Oscar nominated documentarian), Shimshai (famed Yoga singer), Stephen Dinan (CEO of the Shift Network), Dave Ellis (Philanthropist, Creator of the Falling Awake coaching program), Lee Glickstein, (Author of "Be Heard Now!" and founder of "Speaking Circles International"), Marie Forleo (recent guest on Oprah's Super Soul Sunday), Ambassador Tony P. Hall (3 time Nobel Prize Nominee, Director of the Alliance to End Hunger), Gabrielle Bernstein (Author of "Spirit Junkie: A Radical Road to Self Love and Miracles"), John Hope Bryant (Presidential Advisor, Raised more than $500 Million in contributions to support under-served communities), Christine Arlyo (Author of "Madly In Love with Me), Katie Teague, (Director/Producer/Editor of "Money and Life: The Documentary"), Roger Thurow (Author of "Enough: Why the World's Poorest Starve in an Age of Plenty"), Mercy Chidi (Founder of Ripples International an NGO that cares for more than 11,000 Kenyan Orphans), Adrian Lovett (European Director of Bono's One Campaign), Thon Moses Chol (one of the "Lost Boys of Sudan", current Delegate to the UN Refugee Congress).

Larry Reed (Director of the Microcredit Summit Campaign), Kidist Belete (Founder of Developing Families Together which supports more than 3.500 Ethiopian residents), Ken Patterson (Global Grassroots Manager for RESULTS), Rev. David Beckmann (President of Bread for the World, World Food Prize laureate), Ron Schultz (Author of more than 20 books and Director of the  Center for Social Profit Leadership), Fran Equiza (Regional Director for Horn, East and Central Oxfam International), Glenn Moehling (Coordinator for Elanco's international hunger relief efforts). 


Deborah King (author of "Be Your Own Shaman"), Cyndi Dale (author of "The Subtle Body"), Anthony J.W. Benson (Co-Founder of DreamsMadeManifest.com), Debra Evans (Co-Developer of the The 21-Day Consciousness Cleanse e-course as adapted for Oprah.com), Tatyana Ali (actress, most well known for her role as "Ashley Banks on the Fresh Prince of Bel Air").



Dr. Rick Hanson (author of Buddha’s Brain: The Practical Neuroscience of Happiness, Love, and Wisdom), Gangaji and Eli Jaxon-Bear (Co-Facilitators of the "Flame of Truth"), Norman Fisher (Director of the Everyday Zen Foundation), Dr. Ira Byock (Author of "Dying Well", "The Four Things that Matter Most" and "Best Care Possible"), Ellie Drake (Founder of BraveHeartWomen.com), Brian Burt (Originator of the Social Conferencing Movement), Cathleen Spacil (Creator of BrainBeHappy.com), Dr. Mike Obsatz (Author of "From Stalemate to Soulmate"). 



WeForest.org (funded the planting of nearly 1 million trees), The Color of Change.org (an 800,000 member African American advocacy group), Greenopolis.com (recycled more than 46,213,185 pounds of material for a better environment), RainForestECObank.com (replanting local Hope in the Atlantic Rainforest of Brazil), QuestBridge.org (a non-profit team that has assisted more than 6,000 students with a low income receive more than 2 Billion dollars in full scholarships to Ivy League Universities). 



Frank Ostaseski (Director for the Metta Institute End-of-Life Care Practitioner Program), Gil Fronsdale (Author of "A Monastery Within"), Relly Nadler (Director of True North Leadership), Rick Mauer (Author of "Beyond the Wall of Resistance"), Laura Fox (Founder of Visionary Culture) and my mentor Dan Emmons (Author of "Life Force: Experience Paradise in Your Lifetime" and is believed by some to be the most effective solution provider in the world right now) among many other humanitarian luminaries.
lenders.occupational_info:
4 messages of gratitude that I've received recently come from people in my prayer family who have said:

1). "Thank You for helping me to stop being a prostitute and start being someone who cares about myself as much as I care about my best friend."
(Philadelphia, Pennsylvania)

2). "Thank You for helping me find my glasses...it's a miracle!!!" (Albuquerque, New Mexico) 

3).  “Thank You for supporting me so that I can help my children have enough food to live.” (Bafoussam, Cameroon, West Africa)

4). “Thank You for helping me to love my fluffy, orange tabby cat sooo much that I enjoy smelling her dandruff." (Chicago, Illinois)  
  
Clearly, it is miraculous what happens when people's prayer needs are met and if you have a specific prayer request, I invite you to send me an email at: FieldsofGoldforEveryone@gmail.com or connect with me through Facebook by going to: http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100002312497034. 

Here is one of my favorite reviews so far from my free e-books about being absolutely saturated with Gratitude available at: 
 http://www.StrongPrayers.Net

"Oh My God in Heaven...Joshua, I am astounded at your book of prayers. It is heartwarming, joyful, tearful, heart wrenching...Honey, this book is a winner! Thank you sooooo much for honoring me with some of the pages. i cannot wait to read the rest. Thank you again."
Hugs and more hugs,
-Myrna W. Florida, U.S.A

Along these lines, you can also experience a source of exponential appreciation by going to https://twitter.com/#!/StrongPrayers4U.

My intention with all my work is to help people profoundly improve the quality of their lives on a permanent level, and I will respond personally and confidentially to your prayer request as soon as possible.  I'm available to say no less than 100 prayers per day for 10 people each day.  So, if you would like to be on my schedule, I encourage you to contact me if it feels right for you.

On a practical level, I also help people connect with strong sources of effective, integrity-centered funding so that their world serving projects can expand exponentially.  Please visit   www.CEOspace.net to see if our services can help you get the job done.
 
And, as a complement to my other commitments, I help build honest, loyal and Magnetic mastermind groups through a series of permanently empowering teleconferences that are designed to substantially increase humanitarian effectiveness in addition to personal prosperity (my clients have received more than a quarter of a million dollars in revenue and contributions due to their participation in these events).  

In support of your expansion, I am proud to serve as an ambassador for the generous Maestro Conference affiliate program that you can learn more about through our company website: http://www.MaestroConferenceSolutions.com

With all that being said, I hope this page inspires you to explore how Kiva helps people help themselves and I invite you to...slow...down your mind... far more fully than ever before...so you can respond to this profoundly Enriching question...within yourself...as often as possible: 

"Who Would Like to Thank You...Right Now?"
 
For Your Purpose,

Joshua Home Edwards

lenders.name: Cem
lenders.loan_because:
2) The Law of Giving
This law could also be called the Law of Giving and Receiving, because the universe operates through dynamic exchange. The flow of life is nothing other than the harmonious interaction of all the elements and forces that structure the field of existence. Because your body and your mind and the universe are in constant and dynamic change, stopping the circulation of energy is like stopping the flow of blood. Whenever blood stops flowing, it begins to clot, to stagnate. That is why you must give and receive in order to keep wealth and affluence--or anything you want--circulating in your life. If our only intention is to hold on to our money and hoard it--since it's life energy, we will stop its circulation back into our lives as well. In order to keep that energy coming to us, we have to keep the energy circulating. Thus, the more you give, the more you will receive. The best way to put The Law of Giving into operation is to make a decision that any time you come into contact with anyone, you will give them something. It doesn't have to be in the form of material things; it could be a flower, a compliment or a prayer. In fact, the most powerful forms of giving are non-material. The gifts of caring, attention, affection, appreciation and love are some of the most precious gifts you can give, and they don't cost you anything.

By Deepak Chopra..

I believe in this and the butterfly effect    :-)

lenders.name: Speedwell
lenders.loan_because:
Deserving hardworking people are worth supporting.  Good results are their own reward. Success gives rise to more success.  The successful are better positioned to help themselves, their families, and their communities. People help people.  There's no point waiting around for God to do it.

My efforts are primarily focused on lending to borrowers whose loan will: first, support a business that contributes directly to the overall prosperity of the community, especially if the business is engineering-related (electrical, mechanical, architectural, computer, or medical); second, encourage literacy by supporting a teacher, school, library, or print shop; or third, support a business that imports or produces goods that contribute to the buyer's feeling of personal prosperity.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people all over the world with computer problems. I really enjoy the people I work with, and I enjoy solving problems. It's good to know that I can work with Kiva to help solve the problems of people I might otherwise never know.

lenders.name: Shiloh
lenders.loan_because: I've been given a hand up in life, and now it's my turn to pay it forward.
lenders.occupational_info: I use the written and spoken word to promote services that are meaningful to me.

lenders.name: Jasmine
lenders.loan_because: I want to share the blessings that I receive.

lenders.name: Holly and Allen
lenders.loan_because:
We want to uplift lives in a meaningful way. 
"Just as I am so are they, just as they are so am I"

lenders.loan_because: I can help make a difference in peoples lives. Helping people to help themselves

I also support: 
Emergency is an independent, neutral and non-political Italian organization.
Emergency provides free, high quality medical and surgical treatment to the civilian victims of war, landmines and poverty.
Emergency promotes a culture of solidarity, peace and respect for human rights.
